channel.title: Inheriting methods of different types
channel.description:
is this possible/any way of being able to do this? (currently im trying to call the boolean version in super class in the void method to check for some logic but it still is not compilable.
super class: boolean bubbles(int num)
subclass: void bubbles(int num)
ex: public void bubbles(int num) Can this override boolean bubbles(int num) ? if so, how? Net beans is being a hoe :( telling me that bubbles(int) is already defined and should be overrided, however the compiler tells me im stupid and should not bother with the following output: " method does not override or implement a method from a supertype @Override"

item.title: Inheriting methods of different types
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

Unhandled:

You could use a generic base class, but yeah you probably just have poor design.

its for an assignment, I’m making an assumption that the teacher made an error in the specifications, but i wasn’t to sure so I made the post here just to be safe. I tried polymorphism but from what i know you can’t use reverse referencing (declare sub, initialize as parent)

p.s thanks guys

Read full topic

it wouldnt make sense if you could do that, polymorphism etc wouldnt work

item.title: Inheriting methods of different types
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

You cannot change the return type of an overriden method. Find a better design solution

Read full topic

item.title: Inheriting methods of different types
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

is this possible/any way of being able to do this? (currently im trying to call the boolean version in super class in the void method to check for some logic but it still is not compilable.

super class:
boolean bubbles(int num)

subclass:
void bubbles(int num)

ex:
public void bubbles(int num) Can this override boolean bubbles(int num) ? if so, how? Net beans is being a hoe telling me that bubbles(int) is already defined and should be overrided, however the compiler tells me im stupid and should not bother with the following output:
" method does not override or implement a method from a supertype @Override"
